Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming. Okay, since you're probably going to watch this with a baguette of preposterous and humorous theories floating about in your mind, I'll address them here. The kidnapper had a gun, right? His purpose was to kidnap the boy to force his father to illegally create a virus for him.

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.
